question: Which island houses "Piton des Neiges-Gros Morne Important Bird Area"?
explanation: The Piton des Neiges-Gros Morne Important Bird Area is located in the Reunion Island, an overseas region of France in the Indian Ocean. It comprises the Piton des Neiges-Gros Morne volcanic massif which has been identified by the "BirdLife International" as an "Important Bird Area" which supports a large breeding colony of Baraus petrels as well as populations of Reunion bulbuls, Mascarene white-eyes, Reunion olive white-eyes, and Reunion stonechats.
